Key:
(Since we were neighbors, whenever I got home
from school, Yoshino would come over to visit.)
(Well, we are close, so it's not too surprising.)

(The same occurred today, and Yoshino sat
in the living room, watching me work in the
kitchen.)

Want to have dinner with us tonight, Yoshino?
The menu is already set I'm afraid, so I can't
take any requests.
Oh, um... I-I'd love to join.
Ah. Thank you so much, Shido-kun. I appreciate\nall of your hospitality.

I don't mind. I mean, it's only one more serving,
so it isn't extra work or anything.

The food you make... is delectable, Shido-san.
I understand why Tohka-san is so fond of it.

I've made this dish plenty of times. It's not
like an especially good cook.
But men who cook are one in a million.\nMakes my heart skip a beat! You win points\nwith me!
Hahaha. Thanks.
U-Um, Shido-san. I have a favor.
Hm? What is it?

After dinner, or any other day really, can
we have a sleepover...?
(I froze.)
Woooooow! Yoshino, bold move! I can't\nbelieve you're making a move on Shido-kun!

At night? I don't mind, but why do you ask?
Did something scary happen?

No, it's not that... I wanted to go somewhere
else.

Somewhere else? Sure. I can go with you.
Did you have somewhere in mind?

(Spirits were far, far older than they appeared.
Even so, it wouldn't be good for Yoshino to
walk alone at night.)
Uh...
(After dinner, Yoshino returned to the house.)

(Once the time to meet got closer, I quietly
snuck out of my house so I wouldn't wake
Kotori.)
At the end of the day, Shido-kun, you always\nput Kotori's needs first.
Only if it's within reason, okay?
Thank you... so much!

You're welcome. I mean, I don't mind your
requests.
Does that mean you'd do anything that cute,\nlittle Yoshino would ask...
Within reason.
Of course.

That's not what I mean. I more so meant that
hers are easy to comply with.
I see..
Shido-kun, I think you need to think before\nyou speak.

Y-Yoshinon! That's what... makes Shido-san
special.
Oh, okay... Um. Thanks Yoshino.
(Hearing her say that makes me blush.)
Oh, u-um... That's how I really feel.
Woohoo! You two are too adorable. It's\nimportant to communicate if you want to\nget closer.
Of course.
I-I... I... I'm not cute.
What are you talking about? Yeah, you are.
Th-Thank you... very much.
Shido-kun really looks dead serious, which\nmeans―
Why...?

Sh-Shido-san, if I weren't cute anymore, would
you not listen to me?
I don't think... that would happen.
Oh. Why so hesitant?

If I can, then I want to be here for you however
you need me. It has nothing to do with how cute
you are, Yoshino.

But we're here for each other now, so, um...
I do find you cute. At the end of the day, I'll
be there for you.
Oh, um... I-I don't know what to say...
Shido, you're such a smooth operator.\nYou're getting a kick from Yoshino's shyness.
That's not what I was trying to do!
Oh, but... Um... That makes me very happy.
Haha. You're going to make me blush.
(With that, Yoshino wanted me to take her to...)
Is this the place... with the lovely view?

Yeah. You can see almost the entire city from
up here.

(There are crater ruins in the middle of Tengu
City that are visible from Takadai Park, situated
beneath a gorgeous expanse of sky.)
Amazing, Shido-kun! The fact that you fulfilled\nYoshino's request so quickly shows you've leveled\nup!
Maybe. I'm happy you're both enjoying yourselves.
(Yoshino requested to see the stars...)
So, you decided to go out walking at this\nhour? Yoshino, you're such a bad girl...

S-Sorry... Yoshinon, but... I'm with Shido-san,
so I thought it'd be okay.

Right. If you were alone, I would have said
no.
For some reason, I was afraid that Yoshino\nwould be in danger walking around with you,\nShido-kun.
Sh-Shido-san isn't... dangerous though?
I don't know about that. I mean, Shido-kun\nis a gentleman and all, Yoshino, but he is a\na man at the end of the day.
Besides, he seems to have taken a liking to\nhow cute you are. Anything can happen, don't\nyou think?
I would never do anything to harm Yoshino.
Y-Yeah, Yoshinon... I'm fine.
As long as he keeps his word.

Yoshino, sit over here. I'm sure standing
gets tiring after a while.
Oh, okay...
(Yoshino walked over and sat beside me.)
Yoshino, do you enjoy looking at the stars?
Um, I don't know...
You don't know?

All this time, I've never taken the time to
star-gaze...
Yoshino...

That's why... I was always curious. Now,
I have the chance to look at them. I have
you to thank for that, Shido-san...

I see. I'm happy to hear I could fulfill
your wish.
But she exchanged the favor with a kiss\nback then. Pretty courageous of her.
Y-Yoshinon...!
Oh, uh... Sorry about that.

D-Don't apologize...! I don't think you did
anything wrong.
Glad to hear it.
I-Indeed...
(Yoshino then looked up at the sky.)
Hey, are you enjoying stargazing...?
S-Sorry... I don't know what to talk about.
Shido-kun, be romantic and discuss\nconstellations with her.

Unfortunately, I don't know much about them.
I can point a few out, but that's about it.
Gotcha. Yeah, you don't seem the type to\nstargaze as a hobby.
Right?
Totally. Unfortunately, Yoshino's not too\nversed in the subject either.

Oh, really? I figured you would be, since you
suggested we come here.
S-Sorry...

No need to apologize. I wish I looked up some
facts beforehand.
Well, no point in saying anything now.

Even if I don't know much about stars,
I always thought... they were pretty...
Yeah. They're real pretty, aren't they?
So... I think do... enjoy stargazing...
It's easy to get lost in.

(It'd be far more enjoyable if I could point
out planets or different star clusters.)

(But putting that aside, there's something to
be said about staring up at the galaxy.)

Let me know if you'd like to do this again.
Hopefully next time, I'll have some facts to
share.
Oh, right. I'll... do some research as well.
Oh. Why don't we visit a planetarium next time?
A planetarium...?

Yeah. I visited one on a field trip for school.
It's not space travel, but you see some neat
stuff.

Um, I think I saw one on TV once. There were...
a lot of people.

Yeah, there are. It's like being in a theater.
I guess that doesn't appeal to you, huh?

Um, if it's with you Shido-san, I would like
to go some day.
I see. Then, let's go someday.

Okay, but... the stars we see tonight...
So many of them... It's breathtaking.
Yeah.

(Even though we couldn't tell any of the
stars apart from each other, it was, as she
said, breathtaking.)

Shido-san, have you ever seen such a starry
sky...?
...Maybe once or twice recently.

(Even so, there wasn't ever enough time to
take it all in.)
I hope we can go with you someday, Yoshino.
Don't say 'someday'. Why not immediately?

Hm. I feel like I can to a certain extent, or
maybe not.
Really...?
Like... I can ask Kotori.
What, you have to rely on another girl?\nShido-kun, that's lame.
Agh...! Point taken... Sorry.
I... I'm fine, even if that were the case...!

I don't want you to be be fine with that.
You know what? I won't rely on anyone else.
I'll show you the starriest sky that ever was.
Hehehe. I look forward to it.
Yeah, leave it to me.
But Shido-kun, you're a busy boy.\nI wonder when you'll actually do it.

I-I... can wait. Shido-san, I have faith...
that you'll keep your promise one day.

(Yoshino leaned back on me, and I put my
arm around her shoulder.)
Hehe. You're warm...
...So are you.

Um, Shido-san, could we talk about something...?
What did you learn from the planetarium when
you went with your school?

The story has to do with a different season.
Is that okay?
Yes. I want to hear... what you have to say.

I see. Well, it was about the constellation,
Cygnus.
...Cygnus? So... in the milky way?

No, not exactly. Cygnus has this star called
Albireo, and―uh, what was it...?
Hahaha. You're so unreliable.

I mean, the field trip took place a long time
ago. It's not like I was paying attention the
whole time.
What else do you remember...?

Oh, hm... I believe Albireo is a binary star.
From afar, it looks like one star, but there's
actually two.
Oh. Color me impressed, Shido-kun.
Don't patronize me.
...I'd like to see that some day.

Next time, we can bring binoculars. I've
heard using those allows you to see the
whole sky clearly.
Man, Shido-kun, never knew you had\nthat kind of info in you.

Yeah, sorry... I'll make sure to have some stuff
for us to look at next time.
...I already cannot wait.
Right.

(Yoshino continued to ask me questions about
random tidbits I knew. Before we knew it, it was
almost midnight.)
...Yoshino?
Mm... Zzz...
(Looks like Yoshino fell asleep on me.)
...She's knocked out.
Shido...san...
(Yoshino was leaning on me, dead asleep.)

(It might be tough to wake her up, and I'd
feel bad for doing so.)
It is pretty late....

(Yoshino wasn't much of a night owl, so it
wasn't a surprise.)

(Until Yoshino woke up, I lost myself in the
stars.)
